seg.input:
Gratiam et vitę innocentiam a deo per Christum.
Ach, lieber Heinrich, ich kan voll bekümertem herzen wäder tütsch noch latin schriben, so ich so ein unverhoffte antwurt von dir enpfahen, zuͦ dem, daß ich schon bettligerig, bruͤder Caspar still gestelt, dem alten Frantzen allein alle sach ze schwär und in allem Bern nitt einer funden, der ein predig versähen künd hac rerum omnium et hominum turba!
Ich hab geläsen das unbillich anmuͤten, so für den fierden artickel verfasset, nitt gnuͤgsam künnen verwundren und vertruren, daß es uff ein sömlichen propheten eim volck darzuͦ kumpt, et, ut libere tecum loquar, ter miser sum quaterque; citius mendicatim et ostiatim victum congererem, quam ut illi assentirem. Tyrannis est plus quam papistica, quam vix e nostrorum manibus eruimus, et nunc illi non solum suis ecclesiis et ministris incommodant, immo et nostris exemplum et ansam quasi ex praescripto praefigunt. Apud nostrates unica acerbitas non in vitia, non impietatem etiam qualemcumque, sed concitandorum animorum in arma etiam optimis odiosum fecit quorundam evangelium, ubi modestia unius Heinrici Bullingeri omnia recuperari possint. Tacui ego, nolens prophetias extinguere, probare negligens, quod ex vero propheta Zuinglio omnia esse crederem.
In summa sic se res nostra habet: unser puren ex toto agro hend ir bottschafft ze Bern gehept und wie wol ex suggestione antichristi vil ungschickts welle [!] verschaffen jedoch invertit dominus potentissime omnium impiorum consilia. Die von Bern mitt all ir lantschafft habend sich einhellig vereinbaret, bi gottes wort, angenumner reformation mandaten ze beliben und nütt darin geendret, dann daß ad declinandam invidiam et ne functio pastorum reddatur odiosa, allen predicanten abgenummen, imm land kein eegoumer ze sind, sunder das den amptlüten by eiden inknüpft. Si wellend ouch nitt ire pfarrer halten wie dinget schmidknecht von eim Johannis uff den andren, ouch den puren nitt gwalt gaben, si ze entsetzen, wenn es inen gliebt, sunder alle hendel der pfarren form chorgricht oder in sinodis ze handlen geordnet. Es habend wol unser puren nitt wellen das wort «gottlob» nitt dulden, aber min herren hend es inen nitt gstattet. Es habend ouch unser herren unß dick gebetten in eim gsässnen rat, was unß gegen inen anlig, söllend wir inen bruͤderlich anzeigen dess glychen sy ouch. Utinam deus dedisset conventum ante bella hęc misera et licuisset ad saturitatem omnia tibi loqui, quae scribere non datur.
In summa: ich bitt dich, min hertz und bruͤder, wellist ursach suͤchen, wie dir wol müglich und och billich, das du zuͦ unß kerist; hab die artickel ze wort, wellist inen kein inbruch thuͦn, sunder by yrem ratschlag bliben lassen, aber dir sy nitt fuͤglich, die anzenämen, nitt umb dinett willen, sunder umb aller kilchen gottes willen. Dann gwiss: wie si ein spiegel aller kilchen sind gsin, also wend si ein spiegel aller apostat[arum] gen, das alle stett nahi faren werdend. Ich sagen das, daß mitt unser gmeind guͤtt ist ze reden und handlen, modo prudenter, non praecipitanter, modo ex zelo secundum scientiam, non ex propria et quam vocant bona intentione, sed veritate, citra notam fellis.
Hoc vereor, Megandrum (novit deus, quam ex corde amem hominem et ipse vicissim me), etiam si mansurus sit apud nos, parum dei gloriam promoturum; tam exacerbati sunt sua plus quam libera et apostolica acerbitate. Pius in eo est animus, vitę syncęritas, eruditio non contemnenda; sed dum omnia nobis licent, cogitandum num omnia expedirent. Das ist sin span. Do unser herren zum lettsten den lendern hend die proband wellen lassen gon uff gfallen Tigurinorum zuͦ gon, hätt er geredt palam in contione: «Ir rätt und burger hend gehandlet schantlich und unerlich, das ir vor gott noch vor der welt mitt keinen eeren nimmer mögend verantwurten, und üwere wiber hettind wislicher und eerlicher ghandlet, wärind ir die wil hinder die kuncklen gessessen!» - Tu vel uno verbo indica, nunc [!] hęc functionem nostram deceant in tantula re.
In summa abermals: versich dich alles guͤts ze Bern; kumpst du, so wirt din bruͦder zuͦ eim salve [?] von stund an versähen, ze nächst by der statt, wo nitt, so weiß ich nitt, wie imm jetzmal beschicht, dann unser armen ist ouch vil. Ich bitt dich umb gotswillen: kumm, kumm, kumm, kumm! Der bott sol dich ilents selbs fergen. Iustam et sanctam habes occasionem; quod si non veneris, ego cogitabo vel Bernam vel officium relinquere.
Vale et fac, ut venientem lętus salvere possim. Scio, levabis me podagra!
11. decembris, hora octava noctu.
Du glichst dem ernst. Ego scio Megandrum plus Tiguri quam apud nos profuturum.
Tuus Bertol. H.
An Meister Heinrich Bullinger, jetz ze Zürich.
seg.output:
Ah, dear Heinrich, I can write in both German and Latin with a heavy heart as I receive such an unexpected response from you, that I have already been begging, that Brother Caspar could not find anyone in all of Bern to provide a sermon amidst this great crowd of people and affairs!
I have read the unreasonable demands set forth in the fourth article and I could not help but be astonished and troubled that it came from a so-called prophet to a people, and, to speak frankly with you, I am three times more miserable, and I would sooner gather food from begging and alms than assent to it. It is more tyrannical than papal, which we have barely freed ourselves from, and now they not only inconvenience their own churches and ministers, but they also set an example and a pretext as if by prescription for ours. Among our people, the only harshness has been towards those who, in spite of their good intentions, have made a hateful thing of stirring people's hearts to arms. Here, the modesty of one Heinrich Bullinger alone can recover everything. I kept silent, not wanting to extinguish prophecies, and carelessly not wanting to approve what I believed to be true from the true prophet Zwingli.
In short, this is the state of our affair: our messengers have been sent to Bern from our entire district, and although from the suggestion of the Antichrist they have caused much trouble, yet the Lord has turned mighty all their wicked plans. The people of Bern, with all their lands, have unanimously agreed to keep faithful to the mandates of the Reformation, and to change nothing in it, except that in order to avoid invidiousness and so that the function of pastors doesn't become odious, all preachers have been taken away and no one is allowed to be a parish priest, except those who are bound by oath. Our people have not wanted to tolerate the word "thank God," but our lords have not allowed it. They have also asked us very much in a common council what we think of them, and that we should kindly tell them the same. If only God had given us a meeting before these miserable wars, and I had been able to speak with you to my heart's content, what I cannot write!
In short again: I beg you, my heart and brother, to seek a way as it is possible and appropriate for you to come to us; hold to the articles in word, don't infringe on them, but let them be left to their counsel, although you don't have to accept them, not for your own sake, but for the sake of God's entire church. For, assuredly, as they have been a mirror of all the churches, so they will be a mirror of all the apostates, that they all will soon perish. I say this, that it is good to talk and act with our congregation, in a prudent, not precipitous way, with zeal according to knowledge, not with one's own so-called good intention, but with truth and without the stain of bitterness.
I fear Megander (God knows how much I love him from the heart, and he me in turn), even if he will stay with us, will promote little of God's glory; they are so harsh with their more than free and apostolic severity. He has an honest spirit, a life of sincerity, and a commendable learning, but while everything is allowed to us, we must consider whether everything is expedient. This is his opinion. Lastly, our lords have let the preachers go on the condition of the people of Zurich, and he spoke openly in the congregation: "Your council and citizens have acted shamefully and unjustly, so that they can never answer to God or to the world with any honor, and your women have acted wisely and honestly, had you sat behind the wheels!" - Indicate in one word whether these functions befit us in such a small matter.
In short again: be of good cheer to all in Bern; if you come, your brother will be provided for from that hour, first of all by the city, if not, I don't know what will befall him now, for our poor are also numerous. I beg you for God's sake: come, come, come, come! The messenger shall himself lead you. You have a just and holy occasion; if you do not come, I will think of leaving either Bern or my office.
Farewell and make sure that I can greet you joyfully when you come. I know you will lift my gout!
11th December, 8 o'clock at night.
You resemble seriousness. I know Megander will be more useful in Zurich than here with us.
Your Bertol. H.
